lines.text: You know, somewhere in the world there's a right girl for every boy. I guess I found the one for me before I even met you. I tried, but I can't forget her. But don't you worry. You'll find your guy. You're a nice girl Lucy.
[He kisses her on the cheek]
Good night.
Oh you bad boy! Now I won't wash my cheek for a year.

[as Lucy prepares to go out]
Don't worry, Lucy, I'll do the same for you one of these days.
When will you ever get the opportunity?
Goodbye, Miss Schmeeler.
Goodbye, Mr. Chips!

[to his patrol car partner, after hearing about the dinosaur collapsing]
Collapse? That's terrible. She's my favorite singing star, that Dinah Shore!
[the other officer rolls his eyes]
Did you see "The Lost Weekend"?
Yes. I think I'm living through it.
[attempting to escape from the police]
Hilde, do you know where we can hide?
Sure, I know a place right across the Brooklyn bridge where they'll never find us.
Where is it?
Brooklyn!
I was just doing a bit of research.
Dr. Kinsey, I presume.
Gesundheit.
That's the nicest thing anybody ever said to me!
Gee, Gabey, why d'ya wanna chase girls all the time?
I'll tell ya when your voice changes, junior.
How'd you feel if someone broke your dinosaur?
Never had one. We were too poor.

[after Claire took photo of him beside prehistoric man statue]
Er, what are you doing tonight?
"The Modern Man... And What It Is"
I knew you'd come back. They all come back.
Hilde you're the prettiest cab driver in the whole wide world
[Gabey and Ivy discuss where they should meet]
Top of the Empire State Building.
But it's so high up!
Oh it won't seem high to me. I'm in the clouds right now.
Getting involved is so... so... involving.

You oughta feel proud that three sailors from the United States Navy got off the ship for one day, and what did they do? Were they thirsty for hard liquor? No. They were thirsty for culture. Were they running after girls? No. They came running to the museum to see your dinosaur. For months out at sea they were dreaming about your dinosaur.

[singing]
New York, New York, a wonderful town / The Bronx is up and the Battery down / The people ride in a hole in the ground / New York, New York, it's a wonderful town!

[singing]
Some guys care a lot for me. But my excitement they can't fan. Because I still await my primitive mate. We have a date... since the world began, my prehistoric man...!
[dancing with Ozzie]
If through a lot of foolery you lost your last red cent/ I wouldn't even stop to ask you why/I'd pawn my mother's jewelry, I'd steal my sister rent/It's all for you kid, you can milk me dry!
